title: Charles-Tim
author: Charles-Tim
content: Note: Metamask wallet do not support bitcoin, it support altcoins like ERC20 and BSC tokens etc. If you want to buy bitcoin, you can still always follow the decentralized, or the centralized way. If it is centralized, no privacy.Also know that Metamask to support direct purchase can help self-custody, but likely there is no privacy or anonymity about it. I do not know how this works for now, which I will later find more about, but I believe your crypto addresses which you used to buy the coins can easily be traced to your real identity using your bank details. This is a silence means KYC. On Metamask wallet, you can now buy crypto directly using bank transfer, through the help of MoonPay. Quote from: https://m.investing.com/news/cryptocurrency-news/metamask-enables-direct-crypto-purchases-in-nigeria-3035496On March 21, MetaMask’s parent firm ConsenSys announced a new integration with crypto fintech MoonPay, enabling users in Nigeria to purchase crypto via instant bank transfers.The new feature is available within the MetaMask mobile and Portfolio DApp, significantly simplifying the process of buying crypto without using credit or debit cards in Nigeria.If you are a metamask wallet user, you can confirm that for us after updating your wallet.

comments.author: Iadegbola34
comments.created_time: March 21, 2023, 04:36:13 PMLast edit: March 22, 2023, 09:03:04 PM by Iadegbola34
comments.body: Saw it today and I must confess that it's a good development but the only issue I have with it is the high service fee on the transactions compared to when you make the same transaction on standard P2P platform like binance and bybit. Another thing is the issue with the BVN, that will compromise the principle of decentralization if one's identity is linked to a 'decentralized' wallet.

comments.body: It is a good news for the crypto ecosystem in Nigeria but if bitcoin is not listed in the Metamask drop down list for the Nigerian then it of no use for me because I majorly deal on bitcoin and not other Cryptocurrencies. Nd 4 dose who dey use am make dem bi careful. By di way it is a welcome development, dat one set dey show sae crypto awareness is increasing in di kwantri. Charles-Tim thank you 4 bringing dis gud information. Metamask should support bitcoin so that their service in di country will be meaningful to many.

comments.author: sokani
comments.body: This one na good news for the Nigerian crypto community as all this na to help foster the adoption of cryptocurrency for we country. One advantage of the Moonpay/Metamask integration be say e present Nigerians with an opportunity to buy cryptocurrencies via bank transfers. Purchase by credit and debit cards also dey available but according to the survey wey dem conduct sometime ago, 90% of users prefer bank transfer, maybe na because of fear of not wanting their card details to be compromised.But one thing wey I no like na the high transaction fee. If person want buy 0.0362 ETH at N48464.73, dem go charge you N1090.46 for processing fee and N444.81 for network fees, i.e about N1500 for the transaction which is equivalent to $2, and for me e dey high.

comments.body: This is good news as it will help in bitcoin development and easy access and adoption in the country. But having access to your personal detail, the BVN makes this whole idea futile to me.
